messages: fc15bfd3bf22181ab4447a4acd393451 (18:35): what's the progress' "denominator punctuation character"?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:36): fc15bfd3bf22181ab4447a4acd393451: follow the reference to "steps for finding one or two numbers of a ratio in a string"
fc15bfd3bf22181ab4447a4acd393451 (18:36): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: thanks
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:36): 7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967: see you like to stay around
7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967 (18:37): fucking colloquy
7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967 (18:37): it lets me join a channel
7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967 (18:37): then forgets to echo anything in it
7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967 (18:37): so i have to rejoin
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:37): no, it does output stuff into it
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:37): the bug is in WebKit :P
7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967 (18:37): how does it work sometimes but not other times?
7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967 (18:37): and is there some other workaround?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:37): 7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967: Clear the window
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:38): 7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967: shortcut is cmd + k, no idea what menu
7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967 (18:38): so i have an idea wrt server sent events
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:39): http://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=14171
7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967 (18:40): so 90% of the proposed uses of server sent events has been for chat-style stuff
7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967 (18:40): so rather than invent that new dom event stream protocol
7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967 (18:40): how about we just use XMPP?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:41): 7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967: and add DOM hooks to it?
7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967 (18:42): well i mean you could send dom events as the payload
7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967 (18:42): or just use (for example) the messaging and presence functionality already in it
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:46): Hmm, using X3D inline in XHTML doesn't actually seem like a stupid idea any more, when I can import stuff like meshes from external files
fc15bfd3bf22181ab4447a4acd393451 (18:50): and some nice CPU; I can't try x3d out, nobody builds for 64bit gnu/linux
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:51): fc15bfd3bf22181ab4447a4acd393451: Do you mean normal X3D plugins, or Mozilla's canvas-3d extension?
fc15bfd3bf22181ab4447a4acd393451 (18:52): I mean the two builds on http://philip.html5.org/demos/canvas/3d/x3d/test.html
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:53): Ah, okay
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:53): (I've just been running on Windows, since I don't have useful graphics hardware on my Linux computer)
7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967 (18:54): we can combine 3D canvases with server sent evetns
fc15bfd3bf22181ab4447a4acd393451 (18:54): quake clone?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:54): I would assume the Mozilla extension could be built, but Mozilla is not the quickest thing to compile
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:55): I've already done an online multiplayer FPS using Canvex :-)
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (18:55): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: pointer?
fc15bfd3bf22181ab4447a4acd393451 (18:55): I got the video-enabled fx3 here; I'll see about the plugin
7b55d0f261619a93f9ae615a3cb18967 (18:55): yeah 3d games ftw
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:56): (using pipelined XHR (in Opera) and dynamically-inserted <script>s (in Firefox) to get improved latency)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:56): 496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96: It's at file:/// somewhere, unfortunately
496d65bd1d290c6ba6abeeee4f355c96 (19:04): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: ok
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:10): updates his code

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:11): Now you can export some static meshes from e.g. Blender, and then write something like http://philip.html5.org/demos/canvas/3d/x3d/scene.x3d to combine them and animate them, which seems useful

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:13): I think that mostly addresses my concerns over how anyone could make complex scenes, which have too much mesh data to be editable in a text editor and too much complex XML linking to edit in a 3D editor
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:14): though now I need to find some way to import an external mesh and then inject some extra nodes into it, like replacing its <Material>
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:15): guesses XSLT might be too complex
